title: Gingered Yam Soup
directions: Place the yams, onion, ginger, garlic, turmeric, cinnamon, nutmeg and broth in a large pot. Bring to a boil, then turn down to a simmer and cook for 30-40 minutes until the yams are tender.

Purée the soup (see note) and heat to a simmer. Save some of the thick coconut cream at the top of the can for garnishing the soup and add the remainder to the soup. Taste and adjust the seasoning. Ladle into bowls and garnish with the coconut cream and pumpkin seeds.
ingredients: You can use sweet potatoes or squash in place of yams.
2 lbs (1 kg) yams, peeled and cut into 1-inch (2.5 cm) chunks
1 good tasting apple, cored and coarsely chopped
2-inch (5 cm) segment of ginger, thinly sliced
10 cups (1.5 L) unsalted broth (vegetable or chicken), or water
